title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 September 2013 - XWiki
content:
<Slashman> has quit  
00:39 <abusenius> has quit  
00:44 <polx> has quit  
00:46 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
00:47 <polx> has quit  
01:12 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
01:21 <abusenius> has quit  
02:07 <Denis> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:40 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
05:52 <lynxt> has quit  
05:52 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
06:23 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
06:26 <polx> has quit  
06:39 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
06:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:20 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:37 <mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
08:01 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <sburjan`> has quit  
09:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
09:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <sburjan> vmassol: good morning  
09:44 <vmassol> good morning  
09:45 <sburjan> should I start testing migrations now or should I wait for the release ?  
09:58 <vmassol> sburjan: hold on, I'm discussing with gdelhumeau about this, apparently there's going to be some problem and he needs to fix something first  
09:59 <vmassol> he's replying to manuel's mail  
10:02 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:15 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <sburjan> vmassol: got the mail. But I'm a little bit confused. Can I tell DW which to install ?  
10:18 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <sburjan> which package  
10:34 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <vmassol> good morning guys  
10:53 <vmassol> when do we start the release? :)  
10:53 <vmassol> has anyone still stuff to commit?  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> I still have my PR: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/159  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> And I have something new to propose, that I made with Fabio and vmassol  
10:54 <vmassol> how much time do you need?  
10:54 <vmassol> mflorea: are you ready on your side?  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> 1h  
10:55 <vmassol> ok let's agree to start the release this afternoon, we also need to fix functional tests  
10:55 <vmassol> note: I'm working with gdelhumeau to apply his PR  
10:55 <mflorea> I'm almost ready, I want to commit an improvement on search suggest (AJAX source add).  
10:56 <vmassol> tmortagne: ready on your side?  
10:56 <vmassol> mflorea: ok  
11:01 <sburjan> vmassol: could you please answer my question ?  
11:01 <vmassol> sburjan:  
11:01 <vmassol> you should ask gdelhumeau  
11:01 <vmassol> I'm not coding this featuyre  
11:01 <vmassol> featue  
11:01 <vmassol> featuyre  
11:02 <vmassol> feature  
11:02 <vmassol> !  
11:02 <vmassol> :)  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> Sorry, I have answered on the ML  
11:03 <msmeria> gdelhumeau, vmassol: I have the latest snapshot and my Wikis administration page looks exactly like the Rights administration page, not like the snapshot from here: http://main.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki52M2#HWikiCreationRight  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> it is strange, rightsUI.vm has been modified  
11:04 <msmeria> I have the "Wikis template" and "Wikis creation rights" sections, but I don't have any "Create Wiki" right  
11:07 <gdelhumeau> let me look  
11:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes ready on my side  
11:08 <tmortagne> (I'm still working on wiki stream but it's not used yet)  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> msmeria: what URL do you have in your browser?  
11:09 <msmeria> /xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Wikis#|t=usersandgroupstable&p=1&l=10&uorg=groups&wiki=local&clsname=XWiki.XWikiGlobalRights  
11:10 <msmeria> the link in the Administration is just for "/xwiki/bin/admin/XWiki/XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin&section=Wikis" but it redirects to the link above  
11:19 <sburjan> IMO this should be fixed before releasing, or if not, we should remove the image from the RN  
11:19 <gdelhumeau> msmeria: can you paste (pastebin.com) the content of the file: webapp/xwiki/templates/rightsUI.vm ?  
11:19 <cjd> vmassol: to answer your question from the other day, that patch would be pretty dangerous to apply, any way of fixing that bug is rather dangerous given the fragility of the old storage system...  
11:23 <msmeria> gdelhumeau: http://hastebin.com/xoqorilofu.xml  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> it is not the good one  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> I mean, thx for the paste  
11:23 <vmassol> cjd: ok, not very encouraging! :)  
11:23 <msmeria> :)  
11:23 <gdelhumeau> for the content should be https://github.com/gdelhumeau/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/rightsUI.vm  
11:23 <vmassol> (thanks for answering)  
11:24 <msmeria> then fix it until the release. I have a snapshot from yesterday  
11:32 <msmeria> vmassol:  I have an issue which I think is related to XWIKI-9402: on the ColorThemes.WebHome page the names are correctly displayed, but on the Presentation administration page the drop-down list has 4 elements, but they are all empty  
11:35 <gdelhumeau> it seems the last snapshop don't have the last modifications because xwiki-platform does not build on CI  
11:35 <vmassol> yes the build is a mess :(  
11:36 <vmassol> msmeria: I fixed that one some time ago AFAIK  
11:36 <vmassol> yes it looks like 9402  
11:36 <vmassol> let me check locally  
11:36 <vmassol> ouch indeed, same locally :(  
11:37 <vmassol> I'll debug  
11:54 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm done with search suggest for M2. I'm going to revert the selenium upgrade and take care of the failing tests now.  
11:55 <vmassol1> ok great  
11:55 <vmassol1> we really need to get stable on the build  
11:56 <vmassol1> been too long unstable, thanks  
11:56 <mflorea> yes..  
11:57 <vmassol1> going to upgrade jenkins since there are some strange things and there's a new version  
11:57 <mflorea> ok  
11:57 <vmassol> has quit  
12:11 <vmassol1> anyone knows where the colortheme <select> is located (presentation section of admin page) in the sources?  
12:14 <vmassol1> hmm It hink it's in AdminPresentationSheet in javascript  
12:16 <vmassol1> hmm no  
12:22 <vmassol1> ok found it  
12:22 <vmassol1> so it's the custom display for the color theme class property that's the issue somehow, checking  
12:23 <vmassol1> yeah the title computation there...  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> I'll be back in  hour, I'm going to lunch  
12:31 <vmassol1> mflorea: $doc.title is ok but $doc.plainTitle is empty… wondering why…would you have any idea? If not, I'll debug it at the code level  
12:32 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
12:32 <vmassol> actually the problem can be seen on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/ColorThemes/Dusk for example  
12:32 <vmassol> the title doesn't display in the breadcrumb either  
12:33 <vmassol> even though it's set in the page  
12:33 <vmassol> ok I have an idea  
12:33 <vmassol> it's probably because the class sheet has some content  
12:34 <vmassol> and for some reason the doc title is not used an the class sheet title is used  
12:34 <vmassol> is that normal/expected?  
12:35 <vmassol> (lunch time, bbl)  
13:02 <mflorea> vmassol: should be fine now. lunch for me too  
13:20 <gdelhumeau> back  
13:26 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: I have a question about the email you sent earlier about stopping the release of Manager. If we remove manager, will the users be able to create subwikis ? I am not referring to workspaces, but the old subwiki system  
13:27 <sburjan> the one which has its own users, not using global users like workspaces does  
13:32 <gdelhumeau> Yes, if he manually install "wiki manager" through the extension manager  
13:34 <sburjan> Ok, I see  
13:36 <sburjan> I am 100% sure users will be confused about this change  
13:40 <sdumitriu> mflorea: Pong  
13:41 <mflorea> sdumitriu: I made a change to ObjectAdd action and I was wondering if you're ok with it  
13:41 <sdumitriu> Let me check  
13:42 <mflorea> it's a bit hackish but it's very useful  
13:43 <sdumitriu> The xobjectNumber xredirect one?  
13:43 <sdumitriu> Looks good  
13:44 <mflorea> yes  
13:44 <sdumitriu> I remember having another hack for that, though  
13:44 <sdumitriu> Somewhere in a template  
13:44 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: actually, manager was already bundled by Workspace  
13:44 <gdelhumeau> -by+with  
13:44 <mflorea> I needed a way to know which object was added  
13:44 <sdumitriu> I don't remember where, though  
13:45 <sdumitriu> But yeah, it's good  
13:45 <sdumitriu> Actually  
13:45 <sdumitriu> The trigger syntax is "xobjectNumber=" or "xobjectNumber"  
13:46 <sdumitriu> Is that clear enough?  
13:46 <mflorea> I think so  
13:46 <sdumitriu> Should we use a verb instead, like "&returnXObjectNumber=1"?  
13:46 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: actually, Workspace was bundled on XWiki Manager, and the user already had to go in the "WikiManager" space to create old-subwiki  
13:47 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: now, there is just one step more: installing Wiki Manager UI  
13:47 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: so will the user still be able to do so out of the box ?  
13:47 <sburjan> ok, I see  
13:47 <mflorea> sdumitriu: well, as you can see I insert the object number as the value of that param  
13:47 <mflorea> so the redirect URL will have in returnXObjectNumber=3  
13:48 <mflorea> in the end  
13:48 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: and in 5.3, the goal is to easily handle the 2 use-cases by default  
13:48 <mflorea> I'm not sure this is more clear, at least for the code that will handle the parameter  
13:48 <mflorea> (e.g. $request.returnXObjectNumber)  
13:49 <gdelhumeau> sburjan: so the 5.2 is an intermediary  solution  
13:49 <gdelhumeau> (due to lack of time)  
13:50 <sburjan> gdelhumeau: okay, thanks. I'll have more questions tomorrow when I will test :)  
13:50 <vmassol> thanks mflorea for fixing the color theme issue  
13:50 <vmassol> can I close the issue now?  
13:50 <mflorea> yes  
13:50 <vmassol> ok great  
13:52 <sdumitriu> mflorea: No, since we replace it, we can put xobjectNumber in the new URL  
13:52 <sdumitriu> So replace requestXObjectNumber=1|true|<nothing> with xobjectNumber=nr  
13:52 <mflorea> ah, indeed  
13:53 <sdumitriu> But that changes the URL even more  
13:53 <sdumitriu> Not sure which is better  
13:56 <mflorea> has quit  
14:38 <polx> has quit  
14:43 <vmassol> has quit

16:20 <polx> has quit  
16:27 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:33 <Denis> has quit  
16:33 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: did you force the lock on release notes page? I was editing and you saved in the mean time..  
16:33 <mflorea> thus my save overwrote some of your changes  
16:33 <gdelhumeau> Sorry, I didn't force  
16:33 <gdelhumeau> The first time I saw you was editing, so I quit  
16:34 <gdelhumeau> then I went back 20 minutes after, I saw you haven't saved, but the UI did not show me the lock message  
16:34 <mflorea> ok  
16:34 <mflorea> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki52M2?viewer=changes&rev1=48.1&rev2=49.1  
16:34 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: I'll put back my modifications, np ;)  
16:35 <mflorea> I can revert and put mine since it's a continuous block  
16:42 <mflorea> vmassol: do you know why http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-commons-site/305/ fails? is it important?  
16:43 <tmortagne> mflorea, gdelhumeau: would maybe make more sense to list commons and rendering in the first line too  
16:43 <tmortagne> since the RN is about them too  
16:45 <mflorea> I agree  
16:46 <tmortagne> adding them  
16:50 <tmortagne> also updated the release note template, don't forget that this is the reference  
16:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:58 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I think the last 3 failures on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/2691/ are for you. The first two are mine.  
17:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: ok, thx  
17:10 <fmancinelli> Hi. When writing an authenticator which methods have to be overridden from XWikiAuthServiceImpl? checkAuth, authenticate or both?  
17:11 <mflorea> tmortagne: anything left to commit? I want to know if I can start the maven release this evening.  
17:12 <tmortagne> mflorea: many things to commits but nothing blocker for the release, don't worry about me  
17:12 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: it depends  
17:12 <mflorea> ok, so hold your commits until after the release :)  
17:12 <fmancinelli> tmortagne: on what? :)  
17:12 <vmassol> mflorea: shouldn't we fix the build first?  
17:12 <tmortagne> mflorea: sure  
17:13 <mflorea> vmassol: ofc, but first no commits  
17:13 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: checkAuth is mostly for SSO authenticators  
17:13 <vmassol> indeed  
17:13 <vmassol> except to fix the build ;)  
17:13 <mflorea> yep  
17:13 <mflorea> but the build is going in the right direction  
17:13 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: others that basically wait for someone to use the login screen with override authenticate  
17:14 <mflorea> if you look only at the master jobs  
17:14 <tmortagne> s/with/will/  
17:15 <fmancinelli> tmortagne: not sure I've understood. Anyway what I want to do is the following: check the request session if there are some values. If they are there then go ahead and proceed as if the user is authenticated. If they are not there then return null (no authentication)  
17:15 <mflorea> tmortagne: what about http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%20Manager%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%225.2-milestone-2%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Unresolved%22%29 ?  
17:16 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: so that's an SSO and you need to override checkAuth  
17:17 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: don't forget about http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%20Manager%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%225.2-milestone-2%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Fixed%22%29%20and%20%28%28Documentation%20is%20EMPTY%29%20or%20%28%22Documentation%20in%20Release%20Notes%22%20is%20EMPTY%29%29  
17:17 <mflorea> (missing documentation)  
17:17 <mflorea> maybe they just need to be updated  
17:17 <fmancinelli> tmortagne: oh I understand. Ok thanks.  
17:18 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: authrnticate is more or less what the standard authenticators (form/basic) are calling but you are skipping those  
17:19 <tmortagne> mflorea: updated  
17:19 <polx> has quit  
17:19 <mflorea> great, thanks!  
17:20 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: best is generally to look at existing authenticator for the one that is the closed from XWiki point of view  
17:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
17:21 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: in your case probably something like https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/sandbox/tree/master/authenticators/xwiki-authentication-headers  
17:22 <tmortagne> most of the authenticators in https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/sandbox/tree/master/authenticators are SSO authenticators  
17:23 <tmortagne> you also have AppServerTrustedAuthServiceImpl in oldcore itself  
17:23 <tmortagne> can hardly thing of a simpler authenticator  
17:24 <tmortagne> think  
17:26 <vmassol> has quit  
17:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:40 <vmassol> has quit

17:42 <gdelhumeau> about the HTML validation breakage  
17:44 <mflorea> merged, thanks!
